results.title: Formulas and equations
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Introducing Chemistry”.
This is the first of three films for a beginning unit in chemistry. It explains and demonstrates the basic language of chemistry, the symbols used in formulas and equations. Acids, bases and salts are defined in terms of their formulas. Basic terms encountered include compound, gas, precipitate and radical as well as the concepts of structural formulas and “balanced” equations.

results.title: Forgotten loneliness
results.creator_credit: Chris Lofven and Ten Cent Films
results.brief_description: A young Chinese student living in Chinatown, Melbourne wanders aimlessly through the city streets observing the people, traffic and shops. Seeing a group of young companions having fun together, he appears out of place and alone. His loneliness is banished, however when he meets a fellow Asian friend. This film shot during the Christmas season (the Myer decorated windows are shown) is a cinema verite styled film starring Ken Lui and Howard Wong. Music by Hans Poulsen, Ron Snellgrove, Steve Dunstan and Barry Duggan; sound by Bill Armstrong and Brian Kavanagh; photographed by Chris Lofven. (Award: Tenth Muse Prize in the International contest for young filmmakers - Milan, Italy, 1965).

results.title: The Forgotten genocide
results.creator_credit: J. Michael Hagopian and Atlantis Productions
results.brief_description: An account of the genocide of the Armenians by the Turks in 1915. Includes eyewitness accounts and archival film footage. Places the events in the context of Armenian history and culture. Narrated by Mike Connors.

results.title: Foothold on Antarctica
results.creator_credit: James Carr, British Information Services and World Wide Pictures
results.brief_description: As a preliminary to the crossing of the Antarctic continent by Sir Vivian Fuchs and his party, an advance group set out from London in the m.v. “Theron”, a Canadian sealing vessel, to establish a base camp. Her month long struggle with the pack ice of the Weddell Sea captured the attention of the world. This film, a record of that journey, received Honourable Mention at the International Festival of Documentary and Expeprimental Cinema, Montevideo, 1958.

results.title: Football: the sport of millions
results.brief_description: Football (soccer) is a peoples sport in the German Republic. Each weekend some 1.5 million spectators attend the games, and there are over 700,000 players in the 64,000 teams. 500,000 of these are juveniles playing in junior teams being trained in special training courses and schools.

results.title: Food for thought
results.creator_credit: R. Ronald Brown, Christopher Tate, Gerald Wilson, Michel Laloride and Century II Motion Pictures
results.brief_description: Television personality Blake Emmons presents the safe handling of food in the home, based on two principles - the time and temperature rule and the cross contamination rule.

results.title: Follow the leader
results.brief_description: A supervisory training film which makes use of puppets. Designed to increase employee pride in and identification with the organisation. It also aims to make employees understand and be proud of their job and their skill at performing it.

results.title: Folk art
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of home crafts. A wood carver creating complex scenes and individual figures; women painting the walls of their homes with brightly colored floral designs; a potter making and decorating attractive pieces of pottery; expert needle women designing and working intricate pieces of embroidery.

results.title: Focus on precision
results.brief_description: Although large-scale production accounts for the major part of Britain’s industrial output, there is still need for the precision work of the craftsman. This film concentrates on the manufacture of lenses in a world-famous Leicester factory. The delicate machines and instruments needed for the production of lenses of all types must be handled by highly skilled workers. Scenes are included which illustrate the various uses to which lenses are put.
